content: materials about 180 meters of weight 4 worsted yarn 5 5mm crochet hook tapestry needle gauge 13 sts in 10 row in hdcs in the round = 4 10cm finished measurements hat width 10 5 in or 26 5 cm hat height 6 75 in or 17 cm circumference ~23 in or 58 5 cm earflap height 6 in or 15 cm abbreviations chain = chain st s = stitch es slip_stitch = slip_stitch half_double_crochet = half-double_crochet yarn over and pull up a loop yarn over and pull through all 3 loops on hook hdc2tog = half-double_crochet two together yarn over and pull up a loop in the next 2 sts yarn over and pull through all loops on hook bl = back loop of stitch body this hat is worked in a round except for the earflaps so the right side of the work should always be facing outwards notes i used the technique from this video to achieve straight seams when working in the round i suggest keeping count of your stitches every row because it s easy to accidentally add or skip a stitch in the join you can join the row with a slip_stitch like normal but you ll likely have a visible seam that slants however using the normal slip_stitch join shouldn t affect the measurements of the hat chain 70 stitches and join in the round making sure not to twist the chain i joined mine to the back bump and worked my first round in the back bumps of the chain *round 1 chain 2 half_double_crochet in the same st 1 half_double_crochet in every st until end of row slip_stitch to the first half_double_crochet note the chain 2 at the beginning of the row does not count as a stitch round 2 chain 1 half_double_crochet in the next st not where the slip_stitch is 1 half_double_crochet in every st until end of row put the last half_double_crochet over the chain 1 into the slip_stitch from the previous round ** repeat from * to ** 7 more times for a total of 16 row or until you reach the height you want join the last round using the invisible join and weave the end of the yarn on the wrong side of the hat note you can slip_stitch along the top to close the hat now but i found it easier to leave it open when working on the earflaps to close it now turn the work inside out and slip_stitch the bls together earflaps find the last half_double_crochet of the first round and mark it count 31 more sts and place a second stitch marker turn the work upside down row 1 join yarn with a standing half_double_crochet in the first st you marked *1 half_double_crochet in the next 15 sts turn work 16 sts row 2 chain 1 1 half_double_crochet in same st hdc2tog next two sts 10 half_double_crochet hdc2tog next two sts half_double_crochet in last st turn work 14 sts row
